title: Coverlet (USA), ca. 1850
medium:
Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: two interconnected plain weave structures
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 219.5 x 195 cm (7 ft. 2 7/16 in. x 6 ft. 4 3/4 in.)
description: Very large scale rosette medallion pattern in offset rows. Each row has a large medallion alternating with a small medallion. The small medallions are the same in each offset row, but the two large medallions are different. Grape vine border at sides and at bottom a border of small plants. The two borders terminate at the corners which are filled in with a square containing a half medallion. Fringe at sides created by weft loops. Warp creates fringe at bottom. Top turned under and hemmed. Two loomed widths sewn together.

tombstone.epitaph:
Coverlet (USA), ca. 1850. Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: two interconnected plain weave structures. 
1977-55-1.
